document.heading: Moratorium on Retail Service Station Conversion Act of 1979

history.narrative: Law 3-44, the “Moratorium on Retail Service Station Conversion Act of 1979,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-152, which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Environmental Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 25, 1979 and October 9, 1979, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 2, 1979, it was assigned Act No. 3-118 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
